COMMENT_TX: Twins first baseman Justin Morneau left the game due to an injured back

ej,spand001,P,emmep901,Called third strike; threw bat $Twins Denard Span objected to the called third strike; he yelled at HP umpire Paul Emmel and waved his hand as he walked away; Emmel ejected Span, who then threw his bat towards the backstop; Orlando Hudson, who was walking towards the plate to bat, made Span pick up his bat; Span apologized to the umpires after the game
Debut game for Luke Hughes
$Homer for Luke Hughes on first ML at bat

ej,gardr001,M,darlg901,Non-catch call in outfield $CF Denard Span ran from right center into left center and appeared to make a great catch; as he slowed and started to reach into the glove, the ball popped out and fell to the ground; the play was ruled no catch by 3B umpire Paul Emmel; Twins manager Ron Gardenhire ran out and argued about the call; the umpires huddled and left the ruling as is; Gardenhire yelled at HP umpire and crew chief Gary Darling, who ejected Gardenhire
Debut game for Ivan Nova
$the second homer to reach the concourse in right center since the park opened in 2000; estimated at 450 feet, it flew over a video board and the Tigers Hall of Fame display

$on what would have been Daniel Bard's second wild pitch of the inning, Brennan Boesch failed to run to 3B while Scott Sizemore ran to 2B; when Sizemore got to 2B, Boesch ran towards 3B and was easily put out

Debut game for Danny Worth

replay,6,ingeb001,DET,scotd901,DET05,F,Y,I,,H $Brandon Inge hit the 1-2 pitch down the LF line past the pole; 3B umpire Dan Iassogna called it a home run but the White Sox said it was a foul ball; crew chief Dale Scott watched the replay and overturned the call to a foul ball
fan interference
$Tigers center fielder Austin Jackson made a spectacular catch at the edge of the warning track to preserve the perfect game

$Tigers first baseman Miguel Cabrera fielded the ball to his right and made a careful toss to pitcher Armando Galarraga covering first; his foot hit the bag just before runner Jason Donald's foot, but Donald was called safe by 1B umpire Jim Joyce; replays showed that Donald was out to complete a perfect game but Galarraga ends with a one-hitter; after the game Joyce went to see Galarraga, hugged him and apologized for getting the call wrong
fan interference

$on the first pitch to Casey Kotchman (called a ball), pitcher Jeremy Bonderman came off the mound and raised his hands talking to plate umpire CB Bucknor

ej,lairg001,P,buckc901,Balls and strikes; from bench ej,bondj001,P,buckc901,Balls and strikes; from bench $as Jeremy Bonderman left the field, he walked towards HP umpire CB Bucknor complaining about the strike zone; catcher Gerald Laird moved Bonderman towards the dugout but Bonderman kept yelling from the bench and both Bonderman and Laird were ejected between innings by Bucknor
Debut game for Robbie Weinhardt
$Brandon Inge was hit on the left hand, causing a non-displaced fracture of the fifth metacarpal bone

ej,washr001,M,hirsj901,Balls and strikes $after the second pitch to Magglio Ordonez was called a ball and no swing ruled on the pitch, Rangers manager Ron Washington started yelling at HP umpire John Hirschbeck from the dugout; Hirschbeck yelled back and when Washington started up the stairs to the field, he was told by Hirschbeck not to come on the field; Washington stopped then stepped onto the field; he was ejected by Hirschbeck immediately after taking his first step on the warning track

$the line drive by Austin Jackson hit pitcher Dustin Nippert on the right side of his head and caromed over third baseman Michael Young's head into short left field; Nippert was taken to the hospital where the scan was negative
Magglio Ordonez fractured his right ankle sliding across the plate
Tigers second baseman Carlos Guillen left the game due to an injured leg

ej,huntt001,P,kulpr901,Called third strike ej,sciom001,M,kuplr901,Balls and strikes after Hunter ejection $Angels center fielder Torii Hunter objected to the called third strike and was quickly ejected by HP umpire Ron Kulpa; Hunter then exploded as Angels manager Mike Scioscia arrived on the scene; Hunter was taken back to the dugout by the Angels base coaches; Hunter threw the ball bag onto the field from the dugout; Scioscia and Kulpa had a heated discussion and Scioscia was ejected by Kulpa
originally scored as a single, changed on 9-02 to E5, makes two runs unearned
fan interference

replay,8,ingeb001,DET,gormb901,DET05,F,Y,I,,H $Brandon Inge's fly down the LF line on a 3-2 pitch was originally ruled a two-run homer but the umpires huddled briefly before crew chief Brian Gorman watched the replay and overturned the call to a foul ball; it was the second time in 2010 that Inge had a ball called a homer and then changed to a foul ball against the White Sox

replay,6,rhymw001,DET,scotd901,DET05,O,Y,I,,H $the fly by Will Rhymes hit on the top of the wall and caromed off the metal fence back onto the field; it was ruled in play and he reached third; the Tigers asked about the call, so crew chief Dale Scott watched the replay and overturned the call to a home run; it was Rhymes' first career homer; when he returned to the dugout after running from third to home, his teammates gave him the silent treatment

$Casper Wells' grounder down the line was touched by a fan; the umpires allowed Jhonny Peralta to score from first and awarded Wells three bases on the play; Twins Manager Ron Gardenhire argued with HP umpire Tim Timmons about the placement of the runners on the fan interference before changing his pitcher
